abstract: Five years after the Great Recession reshaped the global economy, charitable giving is making a big comeback.
snippet: Five years after the Great Recession reshaped the global economy, charitable giving is making a big comeback.
lead_paragraph: When the Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg gave the federal Centers for Disease Control foundation $25 million to help combat the Ebola crisis last month, it served as a public service announcement of sorts.

headline.main: New Donor Generation Stimulates U.S. Giving
headline.print_headline: New Donor Generation Stimulates U.S. Giving
